Articles.Content:
But it is all around the news!

YES SIR!!!

My god, that's the best news since resources

Twice

Using truss instead or as a supplement to landing gears.

An Eve accent? Why yes, it is quite a strange accent to pronounce. It's very deep, and sounds like you're dying and gagging when you do it.

In seriousness, I've never tried it before. I do want to try an Eve landing without return at some point, though. Eve One, who wants to sign up?

Eve is my new favorite place! But it's also the only place I can reliably (twice) get to besides Mun and Min. My first trip was a bare probe, the second was a science probe with, science bay and goo and some other trinkets. I was hoping to make my 3rd trip as a little rover (un-manned), but now I'm skeptical after reading this horror of a threadÃ¢â‚¬Â¦.

T

I Hyperedited my lander into Eve orbit for testing, made several landings and ascents before I gave up on the grand tour I had planned. Pretty sure I still have the lander craft file. It was some 60 tons sans deorbit gear.

I tend to overbuild my missions. For this reason, an Eve return is pretty hairy. Mission creep led me to design a gilly return mission lander with 2000 dV and a transfer stage providing an additional 2000. How much fuel I burned to bring too much fuel... I'm considering a sample return probe, leaving the Science JR and the goo behind, in favor of tiny science instruments. I'm considering building what amounts to rockets attached to a chair. Ive got the perfect transfer stage, and a space station in eve orbit ready for the mission.

I wonder about the feasibility of a rescue mission. Knowing you won't be able to attain full orbit, burn up high enough to be plucked and docked by a highly maneuverable rescue craft. Would be a nail-biter, and the docking would be horrific, but I can imagine making it work.

Edited December 4, 2013 by thiosk

I have been playing Battlefield 4 and GTA V and have not had time to resume this mission. Since I am just short of making it to orbit I may just scrap it and start a new rescue mission with .23. I am half tempted to do a mobile launch platform so I can move the return craft to higher ground after landing. This mission may not have been successful but I learned a lot from the failure though.
